Adonis Johnson Creed.Action: Accepts water kindly from the waitress and sits quietly in the corner to recover.
Prances around the ring, skillfully avoiding blows from a larger opponent.
Recovers quickly from a serious cut and body shots, then returns to fight aggressively with confidence.
Spits mouthpiece out promptly after winning the fight and listens to the referee's count.
Accepts $500 handout from the referee without hesitation or protest.
Returns home to mother who serves him food and pays attention to his injury.
Maintains tradition by visiting his mother after fights despite her critical attitude.
Ducks multiple strong swings from Flores, lands a powerful uppercut followed by a flurry of punches knocking Flores unconscious.
Spits out mouthpiece and calmly heads to his corner after the knockout, showing composure.
Carries himself confidently at the US-Mexico border, successfully passing through inspection without issue despite visible injury.
Bites at his glove to take it off immediately after the fight, a practical action showing readiness and routine.
Visits Mary-Anne Creed despite their tense relationship; accepts the reality of his losses and family judgment with maturity.
Adonis stands up, and gives Mary Anne a big hug.
Avoids answering Mary Anne's questions directly about school and internship, changes the subject.
Delays making decisions about school and internship, postpones talking to Duke until tomorrow, avoids committing to plans.
Sits calmly at home, puts winnings away securely, watches a boxing documentary to presumably learn and improve.
Engages in a brief loving moment with Mary Anne, showing social awareness and emotional intelligence.
Laughs and playfully pushes Kayla after she jumps on him, showing affectionate teasing.
Gives Kayla $5 for waking him up and helping him, showing appreciation and generosity.
Asks Kayla to make him a shake and bring it to him when he realizes he’s late, showing reliance and informal friendliness.
Tells Kayla not to tell their mom about his injuries, showing a wish to protect or avoid worrying others.
Turns off the screen showing his formidable opponent, then immediately starts lifting dumbbells to train.
Tries to hide his fighting injury from his mother and negotiates with Kayla for breakfast and chores.
Takes thermos from Lisa quietly, tries to hide his face, showing vulnerability.
Responds to Lisa's concern about his black eye with a sarcastic remark, 'stitches' and 'got into a fight at a bar.'
Leaves after Lisa lectures him about fighting and needing a job without escalating the argument.
Engages briefly with Lisa regarding family time, showing openness but guarded.
Prepares his gym shake and packs his bag systematically in the morning, showing a routine and readiness for training or work.
Has a visible injury from a fight, indicating poor decision-making and reliance on physical altercations to solve problems.
Responds to Lisa's criticism with guarded composure, does not escalate the conflict and moves to leave, showing some emotional control but also avoidance.
Walks over to Lisa, kisses her on the cheek after mentioning her mother is alone.
Insists on training with Duke despite initial rejection, pushes into the gym and proffers $10,000 cash for training.
Insists on training with Duke despite initial rejection, confidently offers a year's training fees upfront.
Pushes past Duke's refusal and jumps into the ring without explicit permission.
Challenges fighters openly and puts money on the line, biting stack of money as mouthpiece, encouraging competition.
Mocks Kev's injury and spitting money on his back after knocking him out.
Invites other fighters to step up after winning the match, showing openness and engagement.
Confidently challenges other fighters and provokes them to fight him, demonstrating self-assurance and readiness.
Demonstrates boxing skill by evading multiple punches and knocking out Kev with precise timing and technique.
Bends down clumsily to grab money, indicating a brief moment of awkwardness.
Taunts opponents and acts flamboyant in the ring, showing confidence and psychological strategy.
Stands up and keeps fighting despite repeated hits and taunts from Wheeler.
Looks to Duke for help and expresses frustration and vulnerability by asking why Duke won't help him.
Storms into the living room and turns off the TV, reacting strongly to Mary Anne's indirect interference.
Directly asks Mary Anne to call Duke and tell him to train him, showing persistence and sincerity in pursuing his goals.
Attempts to get Duke to train him despite being injured and rejected.
Disrespects Duke in his own gym, potentially undermining his chances of getting help.
Refuses to accept Duke’s decision and insists on finding another trainer.
Shows emotional impulsiveness by storming into the living room and turning off the TV.
Insists on making his own life decisions despite family concerns.
Responds to mother’s protective concerns with disrespect and dismissiveness, leading to confrontation.
Insists on pursuing boxing despite warnings and emotional appeals, showing determination and self-awareness as a grown man making his own decisions.
Argues disrespectfully with Mary Anne, showing poor emotional control and strained family communication.
Studies Rocky Balboa online and researches Adrian’s contact information independently, demonstrating initiative and resourcefulness.
Visits Terrel Johnson in prison to tell him face to face about leaving and to share personal news.
Shares vulnerable uncertainty about future plans with Terrel, admitting he has nothing set up.
Responds politely and respectfully to Terrel's offer of support and friendship.
Hugs Kayla tightly and affectionately when she runs to him.
Faces Terrel Johnson calmly and directly, delivering clear information without hesitation.
Acknowledges he has no concrete plans upon moving to the East Coast, showing uncertainty about his future setup.
Grabs Kayla's back and squeezes her tight when she runs to him, shares a moment of connection before leaving.
Forces a smile at Kayla's encouragement, showing effort to be positive despite uncertainty.
Stares down a woman on the elevator without interacting or acknowledging her presence.
Confirms intention to fight despite uncertainty about returning, demonstrates commitment to his path.
Uses technology (computer) to maintain communication while away, showing practicality and foresight.
Moves into a modest apartment alone, indicating independence and self-sufficiency.
Stares down a stranger in the elevator but quickly refocuses on the door opening, controlling his impulses and staying composed.
Sincerely compliments the painting and engages Rocky in conversation, expressing interest in Rocky's past and family.
Responds modestly and without pretension when Rocky asks about fight injury, maintaining a friendly tone.
Remains slightly guarded and non-responsive initially when Rocky greets him.

Asks Rocky to sit down and talk, seeking connection.
Requests Rocky to train him, appealing to family ties instead of going to a stranger.
Acknowledges Rocky's legacy with some skepticism but shows respect by listening.
Asks Rocky to train him and insists on keeping training 'in the family' rather than going to a less qualified coach.

Engages Rocky in conversation, showing emotional intelligence and understanding of legacy and motivation.

Knocks on neighbor’s door to address loud music and disturbance.

Focuses on his own heavy bag drills away from distractions while others are watching chaotic sports news.

Blocks initial punches and counters, shakes off hits quickly, ties opponent up when in trouble, jabs to work inside, slips a big right and drives a hard left hook to the ribs causing visible pain to opponent.

Follows Rocky's strategic advice to move and regain senses before attacking with specific combinations learned from family legacy.

Continues to run drills with Rocky right up to fight time, maintaining focus and preparation.

Admits to Rocky that he is freaking out before the fight.

Retreats silently to his corner after an insulting remark from Porter, choosing not to respond aggressively.

Acknowledges Porter's speed honestly and out loud, admitting he is shaken but continuing to fight.

Shows no antagonistic or unfriendly behavior; maintains determination and composure under pressure.
Responds with an uppercut and ducks a hook during the fight, showing some defensive skill and offense under pressure.
Retreats and is described as completely shaken up after a barrage of punches and a late hook, signaling a momentary loss of composure and confidence.
Admits out loud that his opponent is very fast, showing self-awareness and honesty about his situation.
Is criticized by Rocky for watching the opponent instead of taking the fight to him, reflecting hesitation and passivity.
Smiles at Porter and taunts him with a friendly challenge: 'Let’s go! Is that all you’ve got?'
Drops his hands in a playful, baiting manner (Ali style) to invite Porter’s attack.
Dodges punches, protects himself effectively, shows defensive awareness.
Smiles and taunts Porter despite being hurt and vulnerable.
Baits Porter with lowered hands and lands a lightning fast jab.
Throws combos with every third punch landing hard and on target, effectively opening a cut on Porter.
Goes greedy and swings wildly, allowing Porter to counter and knock him down.
Checks on Rocky after seeing him fall and asks if he is okay.
Snaps and insists on continuing to fight despite the bell.
Bounces back quickly to his feet after being knocked down, shows resilience.
Responds aggressively and skillfully with hard straights to Porter's face after being nicked with an uppercut.
Snaps when Rocky falls and demands to continue fighting beyond the bell, showing intense determination but risk-taking.
Fumes and lets emotions show strongly after the break, potentially risking focus.
Follows Rocky's advice calmly and methodically ('One punch at a time... One round at a time') showing composure and patience.
Exchanges blows with Porter despite injury, continuing to fight without complaint, demonstrating resilience and sincerity in effort.
Internal frustration visible (knocks gloves in frustration) but does not lash out or blame others, indicating self-control and tolerance.

Adonis continues to exchange blows despite consistently getting the worst of it, with Porter picking him apart and Adonis getting cut and bloodied.

Endures severe pain and bleeding but continues to fight and listens to Rocky’s advice.
Despite being swollen, bleeding badly, and in pain, Adonis continues to strategize and look for openings, showing resilience and tactical thinking.
Follows Rocky's advice to target the body and executes effective body shots that hurt his opponent, demonstrating skill and adaptability.
Gets backed up against the ropes repeatedly and sustains injuries including an opening wound above his eye, indicating difficulty in defense and possible lapse in maintaining ring control.
Responds affirmatively to the referee's check despite obvious pain and bleeding, continuing to fight with grit and mental toughness.
Looks toward Bianca with wide eyes and recognition, showing emotional connection.
Insists on continuing the fight despite concern and warnings from Rocky.
Endures physical punishment, showing toughness but limited outward expression of vulnerability or warmth.
Dodges the first couple of Porter’s attacks despite barely being able to see; endures a difficult fight and tries to continue despite bad injuries.
Insists on continuing the fight despite serious injuries and warnings from Rocky, showing stubbornness but potentially poor judgment.
Responds quickly to Rocky’s statement and shows awareness even under distress.
Refuses Rocky's suggestion to quit, shows determination to fight on despite pain.
Taunts opponent in ring, drops guard to bait, escalating fight to street fight intensity.
Engages intensely and aggressively in the fight, showing fierce competitiveness but no display of friendliness or good-natured behavior in this excerpt.
Lands a punch during a chaotic fight, pushes opponent back with force, shows resilience to a hard jab by Porter, successfully lands a left hook followed by a right cross that knocks opponent down.
Recovers from being off balance after a counterattack by Porter, slips a haymaker, ducks low, pivots, and delivers a precise and effective four-hit combination that incapacitates Porter.
Embraces Bianca and Rocky after victory, allowing them to support him physically and emotionally.
Acknowledges loved ones as his motivation, showing sincerity and connection.
Helps Rocky with physical support while climbing the museum steps, demonstrating care and attentiveness.
Wins the championship fight by technical knockout and expresses gratitude toward his loved ones.
Leans on mentors and supporters for physical and emotional support after the fight.
Puts his hands around Rocky’s shoulder to comfort and encourage him when Rocky is frustrated.
Gives Rocky space after encouraging him, showing respect and sensitivity toward Rocky's moment.
